publicationStmt.p: for use by the project members

body.p: ODD for the Academy project: Work in progress.

attDef.desc: indicates if the div-element encloses an abstract, edition, translation, commentary or synopsis.
indicates the language of the section. Follow ISO 639-2 codes, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes#N
unse only if the language differs from the language of the parent-element. Use iso 639-2 codes for the value of the attribute: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes#N
describes the hand considered responsible for the content of the element concerned.

attDef.desc: to be used only if the language of the sentence differs from the main language. Follow ISO 639-2 codes, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes#N.
links a bibliographic reference to the bibliographic database.
indicates the size of the object concerned using a project-specific vocabulary combining quantity and units in a single string of words.
indicates folio number, recto or verso, and part. Please observe the structure of the sample values.
links a word to the word list database
indicates the number of columns occupied by this cell. Use if a cell extents over more than one column.
indicates the number of rows occupied by this cell. Use if a cell extends over more than one row.
please observe the structure of the sample values.
points to the xml:id within zone

attDef.desc: one or more words indicating why the text has had to be supplied.
supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the bibliographic work. Follow ISO 639-2 codes, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes#N.
one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the bibliographic work. Follow ISO 639-2 codes, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes#N
supplies the value of the date or time in a standard form: yyyy-mm-dd.
Please do not use the default value "N".
